alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chester; Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chester County through 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Churchtown, or 8 miles northeast of New Holland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coatesville, Downingtown, Parkesburg, Honey Brook, Elverson, Lionville, Glenmoore, Lionville-Marchwood, South Coatesville, Modena, Exton and Thorndale. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 301 and 314. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
